Actual source code: test21.c

slepc-3.16.3 2022-04-11
Report Typos and Errors
  1: /*
  2:    - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
  3:    SLEPc - Scalable Library for Eigenvalue Problem Computations
  4:    Copyright (c) 2002-2021, Universitat Politecnica de Valencia, Spain

  6:    This file is part of SLEPc.
  7:    SLEPc is distributed under a 2-clause BSD license (see LICENSE).
  8:    - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
  9: */

 11: static char help[] = "Test DSGSVD.\n\n";

 13: #include <slepcds.h>

 15: int main(int argc,char **argv)
 16: {
 18:   DS             ds;
 19:   SlepcSC        sc;
 20:   Mat            X;
 21:   Vec            x0;
 22:   PetscReal      sigma,rnorm;
 23:   PetscScalar    *A,*B,*w;
 24:   PetscInt       i,j,k,n=15,m=10,p=10,m1,p1,ld;
 25:   PetscViewer    viewer;
 26:   PetscBool      verbose;

 28:   SlepcInitialize(&argc,&argv,(char*)0,help);if (ierr) return ierr;
 29:   PetscOptionsGetInt(NULL,NULL,"-n",&n,NULL);
 30:   PetscOptionsGetInt(NULL,NULL,"-m",&m,NULL);
 31:   PetscOptionsGetInt(NULL,NULL,"-p",&p,NULL);
 32:   PetscPrintf(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,"Solve a Dense System of type GSVD - dimension (%D+%D)x%D.\n",n,p,m);
 33:   PetscOptionsHasName(NULL,NULL,"-verbose",&verbose);

 35:   /* Create DS object */
 36:   DSCreate(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,&ds);
 37:   DSSetType(ds,DSGSVD);
 38:   DSSetFromOptions(ds);
 39:   ld   = PetscMax(PetscMax(p,m),n)+2;  /* test leading dimension larger than n */
 40:   DSAllocate(ds,ld);
 41:   DSSetDimensions(ds,n,0,0);
 42:   DSGSVDSetDimensions(ds,m,p);
 43:   DSGSVDGetDimensions(ds,&m1,&p1);
 44:   if (m1!=m || p1!=p) SETERRQ(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,PETSC_ERR_PLIB,"Inconsistent dimension values");

 46:   /* Set up viewer */
 47:   PetscViewerASCIIGetStdout(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,&viewer);
 48:   PetscViewerPushFormat(viewer,PETSC_VIEWER_ASCII_INFO_DETAIL);
 49:   DSView(ds,viewer);
 50:   PetscViewerPopFormat(viewer);

 52:   k = PetscMin(n,m);
 53:   /* Fill A with a rectangular Toeplitz matrix */
 54:   DSGetArray(ds,DS_MAT_A,&A);
 55:   for (i=0;i<k;i++) A[i+i*ld]=1.0;
 56:   for (j=1;j<3;j++) {
 57:     for (i=0;i<n-j;i++) { if ((i+j)<m) A[i+(i+j)*ld]=(PetscScalar)(j+1); }
 58:   }
 59:   for (j=1;j<n/2;j++) {
 60:     for (i=0;i<n-j;i++) { if ((i+j)<n && i<m) A[(i+j)+i*ld]=-1.0; }
 61:   }
 62:   DSRestoreArray(ds,DS_MAT_A,&A);

 64:   k = PetscMin(p,m);
 65:   /* Fill B with a shifted bidiagonal matrix */
 66:   DSGetArray(ds,DS_MAT_B,&B);
 67:   for (i=m-k;i<m;i++) {
 68:     B[i-m+k+i*ld]=2.0-1.0/(PetscScalar)(i+1);
 69:     if (i) B[i-1-m+k+i*ld]=1.0;
 70:   }
 71:   DSRestoreArray(ds,DS_MAT_B,&B);

 73:   DSSetState(ds,DS_STATE_RAW);
 74:   if (verbose) {
 75:     PetscViewerPushFormat(viewer,PETSC_VIEWER_ASCII_MATLAB);
 76:     PetscPrintf(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,"Initial - - - - - - - - -\n");
 77:   }
 78:   DSView(ds,viewer);

 80:   /* Solve */
 81:   PetscMalloc1(m,&w);
 82:   DSGetSlepcSC(ds,&sc);
 83:   sc->comparison    = SlepcCompareLargestReal;
 84:   sc->comparisonctx = NULL;
 85:   sc->map           = NULL;
 86:   sc->mapobj        = NULL;
 87:   DSSolve(ds,w,NULL);
 88:   DSSort(ds,w,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL);
 89:   DSSynchronize(ds,w,NULL);
 90:   if (verbose) {
 91:     PetscPrintf(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,"After solve - - - - - - - - -\n");
 92:     DSView(ds,viewer);
 93:   }
 94:   /* Print singular values */
 95:   PetscPrintf(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,"Computed singular values =\n");
 96:   DSGetDimensions(ds,NULL,NULL,NULL,&k);
 97:   for (i=0;i<k;i++) {
 98:     sigma = PetscRealPart(w[i]);
 99:     PetscViewerASCIIPrintf(viewer,"  %g\n",(double)sigma);
100:   }

102:   /* Singular vectors */
103:   DSVectors(ds,DS_MAT_X,NULL,NULL);  /* all singular vectors */
104:   DSGetMat(ds,DS_MAT_X,&X);
105:   MatCreateVecs(X,NULL,&x0);
106:   MatGetColumnVector(X,x0,0);
107:   VecNorm(x0,NORM_2,&rnorm);
108:   MatDestroy(&X);
109:   VecDestroy(&x0);
110:   PetscPrintf(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,"Norm of 1st X vector = %.3f\n",(double)rnorm);

112:   DSGetMat(ds,DS_MAT_U,&X);
113:   MatCreateVecs(X,NULL,&x0);
114:   MatGetColumnVector(X,x0,0);
115:   VecNorm(x0,NORM_2,&rnorm);
116:   MatDestroy(&X);
117:   VecDestroy(&x0);
118:   if (PetscAbs(rnorm-1.0)>10*PETSC_MACHINE_EPSILON) {
119:     PetscPrintf(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,"Warning: the 1st U vector has norm %g\n",(double)rnorm);
120:   }

122:   DSGetMat(ds,DS_MAT_V,&X);
123:   MatCreateVecs(X,NULL,&x0);
124:   MatGetColumnVector(X,x0,0);
125:   VecNorm(x0,NORM_2,&rnorm);
126:   MatDestroy(&X);
127:   VecDestroy(&x0);
128:   if (PetscAbs(rnorm-1.0)>10*PETSC_MACHINE_EPSILON) {
129:     PetscPrintf(PETSC_COMM_WORLD,"Warning: the 1st V vector has norm %g\n",(double)rnorm);
130:   }

132:   PetscFree(w);
133:   DSDestroy(&ds);
134:   SlepcFinalize();
135:   return ierr;
136: }

138: /*TEST

140:    testset:
141:       output_file: output/test21_1.out
142:       requires: !single
143:       nsize: {{1 2 3}}
144:       filter: grep -v "parallel operation mode" | grep -v "MPI processes"
145:       test:
146:          suffix: 1
147:          args: -ds_parallel redundant
148:       test:
149:          suffix: 2
150:          args: -ds_parallel synchronized

152: TEST*/
